Tufts CSDD 38th Annual Postgraduate Course in Clinical Pharmacology, Drug Development, and Regulation
When: February 7-11, 2011
Where: Taj Boston Hotel
15 Arlington Street
Boston, MA 02116
Who should attend: Physicians, pharmacists, marketing executives, nurses, analysts, investors and any professional working with or in the research-based drug industry, and professionals looking to begin work in the pharma or biotech sectors who are seeking comprehensive and foundational industry knowledge and training.
Website: http://csdd.tufts.edu...
Tufts Center for the Study of Drug Development and its highly acclaimed, CME-accredited annual Postgraduate Course in Clinical Pharmacology, Drug Development, and Regulation has equipped thousands of drug development professionals, physicians, policy makers, and clinical researchers with the knowledge and tools required to understand and respond to current challenges in pharmaceutical and biotechnology development. Now in its 38th year, the five-day Tufts CSDD Postgraduate Course remains the ONLY course that cross-links the topics of clinical pharmacology, trial design and the regulation of new drugs and biologics. Taught by leading experts from industry, FDA, and academia, the course is a comprehensive program in clinical pharmacology, drug development, and product regulation.
